articles.title: Stoke Newington: Murder arrest after woman found fatally stabbed inside house after gas explosion
articles.description: The London Fire Brigade said 40 firefighters and six fire engines were called to the two-storey terraced house, and the woman was pronounced dead at the scene.
articles.content:
A 46-year-old woman has been found fatally stabbed inside a house following a gas explosion in northeast London.

articles.title: ‘A dazzling concrete crown’: Liverpool Metropolitan Cathedral gets long overdue appreciation
articles.description: A genius response bridging of history and modernity with daring interior and exterior, it is shocking it wasn’t already Grade I-listed

articles.title: Should Adults Update Their Measles Vaccinations?
articles.description: Despite recent outbreaks, most adults who were vaccinated as children or previously in adulthood remain at low risk.
articles.content:
Most healthy adults who have followed recommendations for measles vaccination are not in need of additional vaccination, despite recent outbreaks in certain parts of the US, according to experts.

articles.title: Are we living in a black hole? New discovery using James Webb telescope leaves scientists alarmed
articles.description: Astronomers using the James Webb Space Telescope have made a shocking discovery that our universe might be inside a huge black hole.
articles.content: The wonders of space continue to amaze scientists and space lovers alike. A new discovery using NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope has generated new excitement and curiosity among the scientific community. It suggests that the universe might be inside... [2078 chars]

articles.title: Unexpectedly deep roots in plants unearth new questions about soil carbon storage
articles.description: Plants and trees extend their roots into the earth in order to draw nutrients and water from the soil—however, these roots are thought to decline as they move deeper underground. But a new study by a multi-institutional team of scientists shows that many plants develop a second, deeper layer of roots—often more than three feet underground—to access additional nourishment.
articles.content:
This article has been reviewed according to Science X's editorial process and policies . Editors have highlighted the following attributes while ensuring the content's credibility:

articles.title: Scientists Discover the Key to Axolotls’ Ability to Regenerate Limbs
articles.description: A new study reveals the key lies not in the production of a regrowth molecule, but in that molecule's controlled destruction. The discovery could inspire future regenerative medicine.

articles.title: CNA is most used online news source in Singapore: Reuters Institute report
articles.description: CNA’s website has a weekly reach of 47 per cent, while the brand is also the second most trusted news brand in Singapore.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE: Mediacorp’s CNA is the most used online news source in Singapore, with its website having a weekly reach of 47 per cent, according to the Reuters Institute Digital News Report 2025 published on Tuesday (Jun 17).
